item.title: Java Notes(1) Keywords
item.author: miao.shihaoo@gmail.com (Shihao Miao)
item.description: All 48 Java Keywords with Examples Table below lists 48 Keywords in Java. 1) abstract abstract keyword is used to implement the abstraction in java. A method which doesn’t have method definition must be declared as abstract and the class containing it must be declared as abstract. You can’t instantiate abstract classes. Abstract methods must be implemented in the sub classes. You can’t use abstract keyword with variables and constructors.

item.title: Java Notes(2) Feature and Program Execution
item.author: miao.shihaoo@gmail.com (Shihao Miao)
item.description: Java Features and Program Execution Java is a programming language and a platform. Platform: Any hardware or software environment in which a program runs, is known as a platform. Since Java has its own runtime environment (JRE) and Application Programming Interface (API), it is called platform. Features of Java : Simple: User friendly syntax based on C++ It has Automatic Garbage Collection It has Rich set of APIs Removed confusing features - explicit pointers, operator overloading, multiple inheritance, etc Object-oriented:

item.title: Java Notes(3) Java Fundamentals
item.author: miao.shihaoo@gmail.com (Shihao Miao)
item.description: Data Types in Java Data Type Default Value Default size boolean false 1 bit char '\u0000' 2 byte byte 0 1 byte short 0 2 byte int 0 4 byte long 0L 8 byte float 0.0f 4 byte double 0.0d 8 byte Data Type Promotion in Java : Wrapper Classes in Java In Java, there is a wrapper class.

item.title: Java Notes(12) Multithreading
item.author: miao.shihaoo@gmail.com (Shihao Miao)
item.description: Multithreading in java is a process of executing multiple threads simultaneously. Thread is basically a lightweight sub-process, a smallest unit of processing. Multiprocessing and multithreading, both are used to achieve multitasking. But we use multithreading than multiprocessing because threads share a common memory area. They don’t allocate separate memory area so saves memory, and context-switching between the threads takes less time than process. Thread is executed inside the process. There is context-switching between the threads.

item.title: Java Notes(11) Networking
item.author: miao.shihaoo@gmail.com (Shihao Miao)
item.description: Java Networking is a concept of connecting two or more computing devices together so that we can share resources. Java Socket Programming provides facility to share data between different computing devices. Advantage of Java Networking : sharing resources centralized software management Java Networking Terminology : Some of the widely used java networking terminologies are as follows: IP Address IP address is a unique number assigned to a node of a network e.

item.title: Java Notes(10) Serialization
item.author: miao.shihaoo@gmail.com (Shihao Miao)
item.description: Serialization in java is a mechanism of writing the state of an object into a byte stream. It is mainly used in Hibernate, RMI, JPA, EJB and JMS technologies. The reverse operation of serialization is called deserialization. Advantage of Java Serialization : It is mainly used to travel object’s state on the network (known as marshaling). java.io.Serializable interface : Serializable is a marker interface (has no data member and method). It is used to “mark” java classes so that objects of these classes may get certain capability.

item.title: Java Notes(4) Object Oriented Language
item.author: miao.shihaoo@gmail.com (Shihao Miao)
item.description: Object Oriented Object-Oriented Programming is a methodology or paradigm to design a program using classes and objects. It simplifies the software development and maintenance. Class A class in Java can contain: field(variable, attribute), methods, constructors, blocks, nested class and interface. Object is an instance of a class. There is only one way to define class in java using class keyword. The Object class is the parent class of all the classes in java by default.

item.title: Java Notes(5) Generic
item.author: miao.shihaoo@gmail.com (Shihao Miao)
item.description: Generic Classes A generic class declaration looks like a non-generic class declaration, except that the class name is followed by a type parameter section. The type parameter section of a generic class can have one or more type parameters separated by commas. These classes are known as parameterized classes or parameterized types because they accept one or more parameters. Syntax: 1 2 3 public class Box<T> { private T t; } Box − Box is a generic class.

item.title: Java Notes(6) Collection Framework
item.author: miao.shihaoo@gmail.com (Shihao Miao)
item.description: The java.util package contains all the classes and interfaces for Collection framework. Map : An object that maps keys to values. A map is not ordered and cannot contain duplicate keys (but can contain duplicate values). Each key can map to at most one value. Collection : A collection represents a group of objects, known as its elements. The JDK provides implementations of more specific subinterfaces like Set and List.

item.title: Java Notes(7) Error and Exception Handling
item.author: miao.shihaoo@gmail.com (Shihao Miao)
item.description: Exception Handling in Java Exception is an event that disrupts the normal flow of the program. It is an object which is thrown at runtime. The exception handling in java is one of the powerful mechanism to handle the runtime errors so that normal flow of the application can be maintained. An Error “indicates serious problems that a reasonable application should not try to catch.” An Exception “indicates conditions that a reasonable application might want to catch.

item.title: Java Notes(8) String
item.author: miao.shihaoo@gmail.com (Shihao Miao)
item.description: String, in general, is a sequence of characters. But in Java, string is an object that represents a sequence of character. CharSequence Interface: The CharSequence interface is used to represent the sequence of characters. The Charsequence interface is extended in three class namely String, StringBuffer, and StringBuilder classes. String Class By String literal 1 2 3 String s1 = "Welcome"; // This doesn't create a new instance. String s2 = "Welcome"; In the above example, only one object will be created.

item.title: Java Notes(9) File I/O
item.author: miao.shihaoo@gmail.com (Shihao Miao)
item.description: The java.io package contains nearly every class required to perform input and output (I/O) in Java. All these streams represent an input source and an output destination. The stream in the java.io package supports many data such as primitives, object, localized characters, etc. Java provides strong and flexible support for I/O related to files and networks. The Hierarchy of I/O Class in Java Stream A stream can be defined as a sequence of data.

item.title: Java Notes(13) Synchronization
item.author: miao.shihaoo@gmail.com (Shihao Miao)
item.description: Synchronization in java is the capability to control the access of multiple threads to any shared resource. Java Synchronization is better option where we want to allow only one thread to access the shared resource. The synchronization is mainly used to : To prevent Thread Interference (Thread interference is a condition which occurs when more than one threads, executing simultaneously, access same piece of data.). To prevent Consistency Problem (Memory consistency errors occur when different threads have inconsistent views of what should be the same data.
